module.name: StdCtrls
module.short: Several standard controls used in most Lazarus forms

element.name: TEditCharCase
element.short: Determines the case of text displayed in the edit box or combobox.

element.name: TEditCharCase.ecNormal
element.short: Normal mode - Character case according to what the user types.

element.name: TEditCharCase.ecUppercase
element.short: Converts every character that the user types into upper case characters.

element.name: TEditCharCase.ecLowerCase
element.short: Converts every character that the user types into lower case characters.

element.name: TEchoMode
element.short: TEchoMode: Determines how strings in the edit box are displayed.

element.name: TScrollCode
element.short: The scroll action type.

element.name: TScrollCode.scLineUp
element.short: Scroll one line up.

element.name: TScrollCode.scLineDown
element.short: Scroll one line down.

element.name: TScrollCode.scPageUp
element.short: Scroll one page up.

element.name: TScrollCode.scPageDown
element.short: Scroll one page down.

element.name: TScrollCode.scPosition
element.short: Scroll to the specified position.

element.name: TScrollCode.scTrack
element.short: Scroll tracking to the specified position.

element.name: TScrollCode.scTop
element.short: Scroll to the top.

element.name: TScrollCode.scBottom
element.short: Scroll to the bottom.

element.name: TScrollCode.scEndScroll
element.short: Scroll ends.

element.name: TScrollEvent
element.short: The scroll event.

element.name: TScrollEvent.ScrollCode
element.short: Determines the scroll action.

element.name: TScrollEvent.ScrollPos
element.short: Contains the current scroll position.

element.name: TCustomScrollBar
element.short: Custom Scroll Bar
element.descr: Custom Scroll Bar: the base type from which Control Bars are derived

element.name: TCustomScrollBar.SetParams
element.short: Defines the Max and Min values, the size of the page and the position of the scroller

element.name: TCustomScrollBar.Kind
element.short: Whether Horizontal or Vertical

element.name: TCustomScrollBar.LargeChange
element.short: The size of the step to be taken by the scroller for a large change
element.descr: A large change is produced by the user clicking on the blank area above or below the scroller; it is rather analogous to the Page Down or Page Up functions of the Keyboard and is typically set up to move the scroller and the contents of the page or canvas by a whole paragraph or half a page or a full page.

element.name: TCustomScrollBar.Max
element.short: The maximum value (for bottom of the scroll bar or the right-most extent)

element.name: TCustomScrollBar.Min
element.short: the minimum value, for the top of the scroll bar or its left-most extent

element.name: TCustomScrollBar.PageSize
element.short: the size of the page on which this scrollbar is found

element.name: TCustomScrollBar.Position
element.short: The position of the scrollbar on the current page

element.name: TCustomScrollBar.SmallChange
element.short: The size of the step to be taken by the scroller for a small change
element.descr: A small change is produced by the user clicking on one of the triangular tags at either end of the scrollbar. It is rather analogous to the effect of using the up or down arrows on the keyboard, and is typically set to produce a movement of a few pixels or a single line of text

element.name: TCustomScrollBar.TabStop
element.short: Whether the scrollbar can be reached by use of the Tab key - default is True

element.name: TCustomScrollBar.OnChange
element.short: Event handler for any change in position of the scroller or other mouse movement or keyboard event associated with the scrollbar

element.name: TCustomScrollBar.OnScroll
element.short: Handler for a scrolling event

element.name: TScrollBar
element.short: Control for scrolling a page thumb in specified range.
element.descr: Scroll Bar is a control that allows user to scroll its page thumb in specified range. Can be horizontal or vertical.

element.name: TScrollBar.Kind
element.short: Determines whether Scroll Bar is vertical or horizontal.

element.name: TScrollBar.OnChange
element.short: The OnChange event is called when the Position is changed.

element.name: TScrollBar.OnScroll
element.short: The OnScroll event is called when user scrolls the page thumb.

element.name: TCustomGroupBox
element.short: TCustomGroupBox - the base class for TGroupBox, TRadioGroup and TCheckGroup

element.name: TCustomGroupBox.GetControlClassDefaultSize
element.short: Sets up default size for the class

element.name: TGroupBox
element.short: TGroupBox - a container that allows a number of objects to be grouped physically and conceptually on the form

descr.p: Group Box. Allows a number of objects to be grouped physically and conceptually on the form; they can be moved around together and have certain properties in common.

element.name: TComboBoxAutoCompleteTextOption
element.short: Defines the behavior of the AutoComplete feature in a combobox control.

descr.p:
TComboBoxAutoCompleteTextOption
defines the behavior of the AutoComplete feature.

ul.li: cbactEndOfLineComplete: Perform Auto-Complete only when cursor is at the end of the string.
cbactRetainPrefixCase: Retains the case of characters user has typed. (This option has no effect if cbactEndOfLineComplete is False)
cbactSearchCaseSensitive: Search completion string with case sensitivity.
cbactSearchAscending: Search completion string in accending order. (False will search in descending order)

element.name: TComboBoxAutoCompleteText
element.short: Set of TComboBoxAutoCompleteTextOption

element.name: TComboBoxStyle
element.short: ComboBox Style
element.descr: ComboBox Style: may be Simple, a single-line Drop-Down or a Drop-Down list, or some version drawn by the Owner

element.name: TCustomComboBox
element.short: TCustomComboBox - the base class from which TComboBox is derived

descr.p: TCustomComboBox - the base class from which TComboBox is derived
Despite similarities in appearance to TCustomEdit and TCustomList , the class inherits no properties from these classes, but only from TWinControl
It has some interesting properties including AutoComplete and AutoCompleteText, AutoDropDown and the ability to create and add a History display

element.name: TCustomComboBox.FCharCase
element.short: FCharCase: TEditCharCase

element.name: TCustomComboBox.FAutoCompleteText
element.short: FAutoCompleteText: TComboBoxAutoCompleteText
element.descr:
Private variable of property AutoCompleteText.
Options for behavior of the Auto-Complete feature.

element.name: TCustomComboBox.FAutoSelect
element.short: FAutoSelect: Boolean

descr.p:
Private variable for property AutoSelect.
When True, the edit control will select all its text when:

element.name: TCustomComboBox.FAutoSelected
element.short: FAutoSelected: Boolean
element.descr:
Private variable for property AutoSelected.
True indicate that the edit or combobox control has just performed an AutoSelect operation so that subsequent mouse-clicks and keystrokes proceed normally without selecting the text.
False is set when the edit or combobox control loses focus.

element.name: TCustomComboBox.DropDownCount
element.short: DropDownCount - number of entries in the drop-down list

element.name: TCustomComboBox.ItemHeight
element.short: ItemHeight - the height of the current item in the drop-down list

element.name: TCustomComboBox.ItemWidth
element.short: ItemWidth - the width of the current item in the drop-down list

element.name: TCustomComboBox.MaxLength
element.short: MaxLength - the maximum allowed length of a string

element.name: TCustomComboBox.OnChange
element.short: OnChange - event handler for any change in properties of the combo box

element.name: TCustomComboBox.OnCloseUp
element.short: OnCloseUp - event handler for when the drop-down box is closed up again

element.name: TCustomComboBox.OnDrawItem
element.short: OnDrawItem - event handler for when an entry is written to the Items list

element.name: TCustomComboBox.OnDropDown
element.short: OnDropDown - event handler for when the drop-down list appears

element.name: TCustomComboBox.Sorted
element.short: Sorted - whether the entries in the drop-down list have been sorted

element.name: TCustomComboBox.AddItem
element.short: AddItem - adds an Item to the list in the drop-down box

element.name: TCustomComboBox.AddHistoryItem
element.short: AddHistoryItem - Add an Item as first entry in History List

descr.p: AddHistoryItem - Add an Item as first entry in History List
Removes the Item from old position and removes last item if history is full

element.name: TCustomComboBox.Clear
element.short: Clear - remove all text and drop-down list

element.name: TCustomComboBox.ClearSelection
element.short: ClearSelection - clear the currently selected text or items from drop-down list

element.name: TCustomComboBox.CharCase
element.short: CharCase: indicates whether text is to be displayed as Upper, Lower or Normal case (as entered)

descr.p: Indicates how text is displayed in a text editing control in the following ways:

element.name: TCustomComboBox.DroppedDown
element.short: DroppedDown - indicates whether or not the drop-down list has appeared

element.name: TCustomComboBox.AutoComplete
element.short: AutoComplete - enables the facility to offer suggestions for completing text-strings

element.name: TCustomComboBox.AutoCompleteText
element.short: AutoCompleteText : Options for behavior of the Auto-Complete feature

descr.p: AutoCompleteText: Options for behavior of the Auto-Complete feature

ul.li: EndOfLineComplete: Perform Auto-Complete only when cursor is at the end of the string.
RetainPrefixCase: Retains the case of characters user has typed. (This option has no effect if cbactEndOfLineComplete is False)
SearchCaseSensitive: Search completion string with case sensitivity.
cbactSearchAscending: Search completion string in accending order. (False will search in descending order)

descr.p: This property exists as a Set of Options, so zero or more options may be operational

element.name: TCustomComboBox.AutoDropDown
element.short: AutoDropDown - if True, the drop-down list appears as soon as the cursor moves over the text box

descr.p: AutoDropDown - if True, the drop-down list appears as soon as the cursor moves over the text box
If False, the drop-down box only appears when the downward triangular indicator at the end of the box is selected

element.name: TCustomComboBox.AutoSelect
element.short: property AutoSelect: Boolean

descr.p: When True, the edit control will select all its text when:

element.name: TCustomComboBox.AutoSelected
element.short: AutoSelected: True indicates that the combobox control has just performed an AutoSelect operation

descr.p: True indicates that the combobox control has just performed an AutoSelect operation so that subsequent mouse-clicks and keystrokes proceed normally without selecting the text.
False is set when the combobox control loses focus.

element.name: TCustomComboBox.ArrowKeysTraverseList
element.short: ArrowKeysTraverseList - enables the operator to use the keyboard Arrow keys to move through the list as an alternative to using the mouse

element.name: TCustomComboBox.Canvas
element.short: Canvas - the area on which the components are drawn or painted

element.name: TCustomComboBox.Items
element.short: Items - an array of strings that holds the entries of the drop-down list

element.name: TCustomComboBox.ItemIndex
element.short: Index - the number of the currently selected item (starting at zero)

descr.p: Index - the number of the currently selected item
The first item has number 0, the second has number 1, the third number 2, etc.
In case no item is selected, ItemIndex has value -1.

element.name: TCustomComboBox.ReadOnly
element.short: ReadOnly - if True, information in the control can only be Read, not Written or Deleted

element.name: TCustomComboBox.SelLength
element.short: SelLength - the length of the text that has been selected

element.name: TCustomComboBox.SelStart
element.short: SelStart - the starting position of the text that has been selected

element.name: TCustomComboBox.SelText
element.short: SelText - the text string that has been selected for editing

element.name: TCustomComboBox.Style
element.short: Style: may be Simple, a single-line Drop-Down or a Drop-Down list, or some version drawn by the Owner

element.name: TCustomComboBox.Text
element.short: Text - the string appearing in the main box. If an item on the drop-down list is selected, it replaces the contents of Text

element.name: TComboBox
element.short: Combo Box
element.descr: Combo box. A simple combination of text box for free text entry, and a drop-down list allowing one of several options to be chosen.

element.name: TComboBox.AutoComplete
element.short: property AutoComplete: Boolean
element.descr: True: Turns on auto-complete feature. False: Turns off auto-complete feature.

element.name: TComboBox.AutoCompleteText
element.short: property AutoCompleteText: TComboBoxAutoCompleteText
element.descr: Options for behavior of the Auto-Complete feature.

element.name: TComboBox.AutoSelect
element.short: property AutoSelected: Boolean

descr.p: When True, the edit control will select all its text when:

element.name: TComboBox.CharCase
element.short: property CharCase: TEditCharCase

descr.p: Indicates how text is displayed in a text editing control in the following ways:

element.name: TCustomListBox
element.short: TCustomList Box: the base class for TListBox

element.name: TCustomListBox.Canvas
element.short: Canvas - defines the area on which all graphic material is drawn

element.name: TCustomListBox.Columns
element.short: Columns - the number of vertical columns in which the Items are arranged

element.name: TCustomListBox.Count
element.short: Count - the number of entries in the list of Items

element.name: TCustomListBox.ExtendedSelect
element.short: ExtendedSelect - boolean. Whether extended selection is allowed. Default True

element.name: TCustomListBox.ItemHeight
element.short: ItemHeight - the height of the individual Items

element.name: TCustomListBox.ItemIndex
element.short: ItemIndex: Integer to indicate the currently selected item (zero origin)
element.descr: Indicates the currently selected item. The first item has number 0, the second has number 1, the third number 2, etc. In case no item is selected, ItemIndex has value -1. If MultiSelect is True, ItemIndex represents the item which has focus, which typically has a different color from the other items.

element.name: TCustomListBox.Items
element.short: Items - an array of strings representing the list of entries

element.name: TCustomListBox.MultiSelect
element.short: MultiSelect - boolean; True allows more than one Item from the list to be selected at a time

element.name: TCustomListBox.Style
element.short: Style of List Box - normal, owner-draw fixed, or owner-draw variable

element.name: TListBox
element.short: TListBox: a simple drop-down (string) list from which a choice is made

descr.p: TListBox: a simple drop-down (string) list from which a choice is made
The array of strings is held in Items

element.name: TCustomEdit
element.short: TCustomEdit : the base type from which the TEdit Box is derived.

descr.p: TCustomEdit : the base type from which the TEdit Box is derived.
This control deals, for example, with issues such as selection of text sub-strings within the whole text string which are to be edited (cut, pasted, deleted, highlighted etc)

element.name: TCustomEdit.FAutoSelect
element.short: FAutoSelect: Boolean

descr.p: Private variable for property AutoSelect.
When True, the edit control will select all its text when:

element.name: TCustomEdit.FAutoSelected
element.short: FAutoSelected: Boolean
element.descr:
Private variable for property AutoSelected.
True indicate that the edit or combobox control has just performed an AutoSelect opertation so that subsequent mouse-clicks and keystrokes proceds normally without selecting the text.
False is set when the edit or combobox control loses focus.

element.name: TCustomEdit.FCharCase
element.short: FCharCase: TEditCharCase

descr.p:
Private variable for property CharCase.
Indicates how text is displayed in a text editing control.

element.name: TCustomEdit.AutoSelect
element.short: AutoSelect: if True, the edit control will select all its text when it receives focus or when the Enter key is pressed.

element.name: TCustomEdit.AutoSelected
element.short: AutoSelected: if True, indicates that the edit control has just performed an AutoSelect operation

descr.p: If True, indicates that the edit control has just performed an AutoSelect operation so that subsequent mouse-clicks and keystrokes proceed normally without selecting the text.
False is set when the edit control loses focus.

element.name: TCustomEdit.Clear
element.short: Clear - delete all text

element.name: TCustomEdit.SelectAll
element.short: SelectAll text, for example in order to copy or delete it

element.name: TCustomEdit.ClearSelection
element.short: ClearSelection - delete all characters in selected text

element.name: TCustomEdit.CopyToClipboard
element.short: CopyToClipboard - put a copy of the selection on the clipboard, while leaving the original text in place

element.name: TCustomEdit.CutToClipboard
element.short: CutToClipboard - remove the selected text from its original location and put it on the clipboard

element.name: TCustomEdit.PasteFromClipboard
element.short: PasteFromClipboard - put a copy of the clipboard contents at the current writing position

element.name: TCustomEdit.CharCase
element.short: TEditCharCase - rules for what case to use (upper or lower) to display text

descr.p: Indicates how text is displayed in a text editing control in the following ways:
The rules can, of course, be overridden by use of the shift key.

element.name: TCustomEdit.EchoMode
element.short: EchoMode - how to echo keypresses on screen: normal (returning the actual character for that key), all upper or lower case, or a masking character as used in entering passwords

element.name: TCustomEdit.MaxLength
element.short: MaxLength: maximum length allowed for text string

element.name: TCustomEdit.Modified
element.short: Modified
element.descr: Modified: has the text been modified since creation?

element.name: TCustomEdit.OnChange
element.short: OnChange - event handler for any change in text

element.name: TCustomEdit.PasswordChar
element.short: PasswordChar: the character which appears in the Edit box replacing and masking the actual character typed

descr.p: PasswordChar: the character which appears in the Edit box replacing and masking the actual character typed.
Typically used in password input, to prevent the typed characters from being seen by passers-by or casual observers (or even malicious observers!)

element.name: TCustomEdit.ReadOnly
element.short: ReadOnly - the contents of the edit box may only be read, not written or erased

element.name: TCustomEdit.SelLength
element.short: SelLength: the length (in characters) of the text that has been selected for editing

element.name: TCustomEdit.SelStart
element.short: Sel Start: the index of the character from which selection (for editing) begins

element.name: TCustomEdit.SelText
element.short: Sel Text: the string within the edit control that has been selected for editing

element.name: TCustomEdit.Text
element.short: Text: the character string contained in the Edit Box
element.descr: Text: the character string contained in the Edit Box

element.name: TMemoScrollbar
element.short: Scroll Bar specifically for use in Memo Boxes
element.descr: Scroll Bar specifically for use in Memo Boxes. Inherits most of its properties from its ancestor, TControlScrollBar

element.name: TCustomMemo
element.short: TCustomMemo: the base class for TMemo

element.name: TCustomMemo.Create
element.short: Create
element.descr: Create the Custom memo widget

element.name: TCustomMemo.Destroy
element.short: Destroy
element.descr: Destroy the CustomMemo widget when you have finished with it

element.name: TCustomMemo.Append
element.short: Append - procedure for adding a text string to the Memo

element.name: TCustomMemo.Alignment
element.short: Alignment - whether text is centered, left- or right-justified

element.name: TCustomMemo.Lines
element.short: Lines : an array of strings (single lines of characters) which contains the text held or being entered in the Memo
element.descr: Lines: an array of strings (representing single lines of characters) which contains the textual material held or being entered in the Memo. The array is zero-indexed, ie the strings are numbered [0..numLines-1]

element.name: TCustomMemo.ScrollBars
element.short: Whether the Memo has ScrollBars - none, horizontal or vertical or both, or automatically placed if needed

element.name: TCustomMemo.WordWrap
element.short: Is WordWrap enabled, allowing long words to be carried on to the next line?
element.descr: Word Wrap: a logical flag to show whether or not word-wrap is enabled, ie if a word is close to the end of a line and is going to be too long for the line, it is wrapped down to the next line

element.name: TEdit
element.short: TEdit - an Edit Box: for entry or display of a single line of text.

element.name: TEdit.PasswordChar
element.short: Password Character
element.descr: Password Character - defines which character should appear in the edit box when a password is being typed.

element.name: TMemo
element.short: TMemo - a box for entry or display of multiple lines of text

descr.p: TMemo - a box for entry or display of multiple lines of text.
The textual data is held as an array of strings in Lines, where it can be edited

element.name: TMemo.MaxLength
element.short: Max Length
element.descr: Max Length: the maximum permitted length for the textual material in the memo

element.name: TMemo.WordWrap
element.short: Word Wrap
element.descr: Word Wrap: a logical flag to show whether or not word-wrap is enabled, ie if a word comes near the end of a line and is going to be too long for the line, it is wrapped down to the next line

element.name: TCustomStaticText
element.short: TCustomStaticText: the base class for Static Text

element.name: TCustomStaticText.Alignment
element.short: Alignment - whether text is centered, left- or right-justified

element.name: TCustomStaticText.ShowAccelChar
element.short: ShowAccelChar - underline the character in the static text that acts as an accelerator with a shortcut key

descr.p: ShowAccelChar - underline the character in the static text that acts as an accelerator with a shortcut key
Boolean property - default True

element.name: TStaticText
element.short: TStaticText: a box to display a Constant Text String

descr.p: TStaticText: a box to display a Constant Text String
Use this control to display a statement or comment that is not likely to change very often, or is not usually responsive to user actions

element.name: TStaticText.Align
element.short: Align
element.descr: Align: Is used to align a Static Text box to a border of a parent control.

element.name: TStaticText.Anchors
element.short: Anchors
element.descr: Anchors: keep the edges of a static text box a defined distance from certain borders of the parent control.

element.name: TStaticText.Caption
element.short: Caption
element.descr: Caption: the text that actually appears with the Static Text Box

element.name: TStaticText.Constraints
element.short: Constraints
element.descr: Constraints: Sets the minimum and maximum sizes for a control.

element.name: TStaticText.OnClick
element.short: On Click - Action
element.descr: On Click - Action to be taken when the mouse button is clicked with the cursor over this control. User-defined Procedure

element.name: TStaticText.OnDblClick
element.short: On Double-click - Action
element.descr: On Double-click - Action to be taken when the mouse button is double-clicked while the cursor is over the control. User-defined Procedure

element.name: TStaticText.OnMouseDown
element.short: On Mouse Down - Action
element.descr: On Mouse Down - Action to be taken when the mouse button is down while the cursor is over this control. User-defined Procedure

element.name: TStaticText.OnMouseEnter
element.short: On Mouse Entry - Action
element.descr: On Mouse Entry - Action to be taken when the mouse cursor enters the bounds of this control. User-defined Procedure

element.name: TStaticText.OnMouseLeave
element.short: On Mouse Leaving - Action
element.descr: On Mouse Leaving - Action to be taken when the mouse cursor leaves the boundaries of this control. User-defined Procedure.

element.name: TStaticText.OnMouseMove
element.short: On Mouse Movement - Action
element.descr: On Mouse Movement - Action to be taken if the mouse cursor moves within the bounds of this control. User-defined Procedure

element.name: TStaticText.OnMouseUp
element.short: On Mouse Up - Action
element.descr: On Mouse Up - Action to be taken if the mouse button is up while the cursor is over this control.

element.name: TStaticText.OnResize
element.short: On Resize - Action
element.descr: On Resize - Action to be taken when the control is resized. Might include re-alignment of text or selection of a different font size etc. User-defined Procedure

element.name: TStaticText.Visible
element.short: Visible
element.descr: Visible - determines whether or not the control can be seen

element.name: TButtonControl
element.short: TButtonControl: ancestor class for several Button (including Radio Button) and Check Box classes

element.name: TButtonControl.Click
element.short: Click - the procedure which allows programmatic simulation of a mouse click

descr.p: Click - the procedure which allows programmatic simulation of a mouse click, and thus activation of the Action associated with the OnClick event

element.name: TButtonControl.Checked
element.short: Checked - whether this button has been checked, which signifies selection

element.name: TButtonControl.OnChange
element.short: OnChange - event handler for any change in properties of the control

element.name: TCustomButton
element.short: TCustomButton - the base class for TButton and TBitBtn

element.name: TCustomButton.Create
element.short: Creates a new instance of the TCustomButton class
element.descr: If you drop a component on the form editor you dont need to add code to explicitly create it. The component is automatically created together with the the form, and destroyed when the form is destroyed.

element.name: TCustomButton.ExecuteDefaultAction
element.short: Performs the action associated with the button if it is the Default button

element.name: TCustomButton.ExecuteCancelAction
element.short: Performs the action associated with the button if it is a Cancel button or if 'Escape' was pressed

element.name: TCustomButton.Active
element.short: Is this control Active - has it got Focus; is the mouse over it?

element.name: TCustomButton.Default
element.short: Is this the Default button? (default setting is False)

descr.p: Defines if a button is the Default on a form. That is, pressing ENTER will execute its onClick method, whether the control has focus or not!

element.name: TCustomButton.ModalResult
element.short: Is a Modal Result awaited? (default is false)

element.name: TCustomButton.Cancel
element.short: Is this the Cancel button? (default setting is False)

descr.p: Setting this property to true, will have the effect that when the user hits ESC this button is Clicked, even if the button does not have focus. Usually the Button which reacts to ESC sets the ModalResult of the form to mrCancel.

element.name: TCustomButton.Color
element.short: What Colour is the button? (default is the same as all other button faces)

element.name: TCustomButton.TabStop
element.short: Is the Button included in the TabStop list? (default setting is True)

element.name: TButton
element.short: TButton: Base type for all Buttons. A push button control

descr.p: TButton: Base type for all Buttons. A push button control.
The user pushes a button (eg selects it with the mouse cursor and clicks the mouse) to start an action.

element.name: TButton.Click
element.short: Click, calling this method will invoke the OnClick event of the button
element.descr: If you want to programmatically Click on a button you can call its Click method. This will have the same effect as a user clicking on the button.

element.name: TButton.Caption
element.short: Sets the text displayed on the button.

element.name: TButton.Constraints
element.short: Constraints can be used to give a control certain minimum and or maximum dimensions.
element.descr: Sets the minimum and maximum sizes for a control. If a control is resized the new dimensions are allways within the ranges given here. You should take care when setting these options that they do not conflict with the Anchors and Align settings.

element.name: TButton.Font
element.short: Font is used to set the font of the caption of the Button.
element.descr: Font is used to set the font of the caption of the Button.

element.name: TButton.ModalResult
element.short: If the button gets clicked, the ModalResult of the form will be set to this value.
element.descr: Setting ModalResult of a button makes closing a form easy.

element.name: TButton.OnClick
element.descr: The OnClick event is triggered when a user clicks on the button. It can also be invoked by calling the Click method.

element.name: TCheckBoxState
element.short: Check Box State
element.descr: Check Box State: a set of constants defining the possible states of a Check Box -

element.name: TCheckBoxState.cbUnchecked
element.descr: The check box has no check mark, indicating that the user has not selected the option.

element.name: TCheckBoxState.cbChecked
element.descr: The check box has a check mark in it, indicating that the user has selected the option.

element.name: TCheckBoxState.cbGrayed
element.descr: The check box has a check mark in it, but it is grayed.

element.name: TCustomCheckBox
element.short: TCustomCheckBox is the ancestor of all check-box components.

descr.p: TCustomCheckBox: The base (abstract) class from which the TCheckBox is derived.
Check boxes present the user with options that can be selected (checked) or deselected (unchecked).

element.name: TCustomCheckBox.AllowGrayed
element.short: Determines whether the check box can be in a "grayed" state.

descr.p: If AllowGrayed is set to True, the check box has three possible states: checked, unchecked and grayed. If AllowGrayed is set to False, the check box has only two possible states: checked and unchecked.

element.name: TCustomCheckBox.State
element.short: Indicates whether the check box is checked (selected), unchecked (deselected) or grayed.

descr.p: See TCheckBoxState for possible values of State.

element.name: TCustomCheckBox.TabStop
element.descr:
Use the TabStop to allow or disallow access to the control using the Tab key.
If the TabStop is True, the control is in the tab order. If TabStop is False, the control is not in the tab order and the user can't press the Tab key to move to the control.

element.name: TCheckBox
element.short: TCheckBox - a small box which can contain a check mark to indicate that it has been selected by a mouse click

descr.p: TCheckBox: a small box which can contain a check mark to indicate that it has been selected by a mouse click. May be associated with a Caption that describes its function.

element.name: TCheckBox.Checked
element.short: Checked - shows whether or not the box has been checked (ie selected)

element.name: TToggleBox
element.short: TToggle Box: a labelled box capable of being checked or unchecked

descr.p: TToggle Box: a labelled box capable of being checked (when it becomes recessed) or unchecked (when it is raised).

The Application Programmer is responsible for ensuring that the OnClick event handler recognises the State of the box, takes the appropriate Action and places the State into the next appropriate value

element.name: TRadioButton
element.short: TRadioButton: a button that works with other Radio Buttons in a mutually exclusive way - if one button is selected, none of the others in the group can be selected

descr.p: TRadioButton: a button that works in conjunction with other Radio Buttons in a mutually exclusive manner - if one button of a group is selected, none of the others in that group can be selected.

The Application Programmer is responsible for ensuring that the OnClick event handler for each button has a unique Action, and that the Actions of the other (deselected and therefore inactive) buttons are turned off.

element.name: TCustomLabel
element.short: Custom Label
element.descr: Custom label: the base type from which Label is derived.

element.name: TCustomLabel.Alignment
element.short: Alignment - whether text is centered, left- or right-justified

element.name: TCustomLabel.FocusControl
element.short: FocusControl - whether this control has focus

element.name: TCustomLabel.Layout
element.short: Layout - How the Text is to be laid out in the text rectangle: at the Bottom, Centre or Top

element.name: TCustomLabel.ShowAccelChar
element.short: ShowAccelChar - underline the character in the label that acts as an accelerator with a shortcut key

descr.p: ShowAccelChar - underline the character in the label that acts as an accelerator with a shortcut key
Boolean property - default True

element.name: TCustomLabel.Transparent
element.short: Transparent - whether the viewer can see through the control. Default True

element.name: TCustomLabel.WordWrap
element.short: WordWrap - whether a word is to be wrapped to the next line if the text is about to become too long for the width available

descr.p: WordWrap - whether a word is to be wrapped to the next line if the text is about to become too long for the width available
Boolean property, default False

element.name: TCustomLabel.OptimalFill
element.short: OptimalFill - boolean. If True, font size is adjusted for optimal fill of available space

element.name: TLabel
element.short: TLabel: a brief text label to be placed in the Form near any object that needs to be identified.

topic.name: HowToUseStdCtrls
topic.short: How to use StdCtrls, ComCtrls or ExtCtrls

descr.p: The Units StdCtrls, ComCtrls and ExtCtrls contain definitions and descriptions of many of the most commonly used controls for constructing Forms and other Objects in Lazarus Applications.

Many of the final target controls that the application developer wants to use, such as TButton, TMemo, TScrollBar etc, have a corresponding ancestor class such as TCustomButton, TCustomMemo or TCustomScrollBar. Several of the properties and methods relevant to the final target control are defined (and explained) more fully in the TCustomXXX class, and are inherited by the final target control.

If you drop a component on the form editor you don't need to add code explicitly to create it. The component is automatically created by the IDE together with the form, and destroyed when the form is destroyed.
However, if you create the component yourself by code don't forget to free it when it is no longer needed.
If you place a component on the Form Designer and look at the Object Inspector, you can observe the properties change as you move the component around.

For example, if you place a button (TButton) on the form, click on it to select it, then move it around the form with the mouse, you can watch the values of Top and Left change in the Object Inspector to reflect the new position. If you use the object's re-sizing bars to adjust its size, you can watch the Height and Width properties change as well.

On the other hand, by using the Object Inspector, you can select the value associated with a property such as height, and type in a new value; you can watch the size of the object on the form change to reflect the new value.
You can also explicitly change the properties of the object in code by typing (in the appropriate Implementation section of the Source editor), for example

If you type this new value into the Source Editor and then look back at the Form Designer, you will see that the button on the Form has taken the new size. The new value will also be shown in the Object Inspector.
In summary, there are usually about three different ways to determine each property of an object:

ul.li: by setting the values in the Object Inspector,

descr.p: The components defined in these Units have several properties that are common to most of them, and other properties that are specific to the individual components. We shall describe the most common ones here. Unusual or control-specific properties will be described for the individual controls.

Additional Help can always be obtained by selecting a property or keyword, in either the Object Inspector or the Source Editor, and pressing F1. You will be taken by your Help browser to the appropriate page in the documentation.

If the description of a property on that page is insufficient, you can navigate to the corresponding description in the ancestor classes, by selecting the links in the Inheritance listing or by selecting the ancestor Type in the declaration of the object.

Constructors
such as Create allocate memory and system resources needed by the object. They also call the constructor of any sub-objects present in the class.

Destructors:
remove the object and de-allocate memory and other resources. If you call Destroy for an object which hasn't being initialized yet it will generate an error. Always use the Free method to deallocate objects, because it checks whether an object's value is nil before invoking Destroy.
Take the following precautions when creating your own Destroy method:

ul.li: Declare Destroy with the override directive, because it is a virtual method.
Always call 'inherited Destroy;' as the last thing on the destructor code.

Be aware that an exception may be raised on the constructor in case there is not enought memory to create an object, or something else goes wrong. If the exception is not handled inside the constructor, the object will be only partially built. In this case Destroy will be called when you weren't expecting it, so your destructor must check if the resources were really allocated before disposing of them.
Remember to call Free for all objects created on the constructor.

tr.td: The main action or event associated with the object. For example selecting an 'Exit' Button might cause the 'Close' action

Defines the way in which an object is to be lined up with the parent object. Possible values are alTop (placed at the top and using the full available width), alBottom, alLeft (placed at the left and using the full available height), alRight. alNone (place anywhere on parent control) or alClient (takes all available space next to controls aligned to top, bottom, left or right)

Used to keep a control a certain distance from the defined edges of a parent control, when the parent is resized. For example [akBottom, akRight] will keep the control a fixed distance from the bottom right corner.
When True, an editing control will select all its text when it receives focus or when the Enter key is pressed.
True indicate that the edit or combobox control has just performed an AutoSelect operation so that subsequent mouse-clicks and keystrokes proceed normally without selecting the text.
The space around the edge between an Anchored control and its parent.

The text that is displayed on or near the control; it should preferably give some clue as to the function of the control, or an instruction such as 'Close' or 'Execute'. By default Caption is set to be the same as the 'Name' property, and the application programmer should substitute meaningful text instead of the default values.
Indicates how text is displayed in a text editing control: Normal (retaining the case of the letters typed by the user), converted to uppercase, or converted to lowercase

Sets the minimum and maximum sizes for a control. If a control is resized the new dimensions are always within the ranges given here. You should take care when setting these options that they do not conflict with the Anchors and Align settings.
The Colour to be used to draw the control or to write the text it contains.
A Boolean property to determine whether or not a control is capable of being selected and performing an action. If it is not Enabled, it is often Grayed out on the Form.

The Font to be used for writing the text associated with the control - either the caption or label, or the text-strings contained within the control. The entry on the Object Inspector usually has a (+) box on the left, and selecting this box reveals further options such as character set, colour and size.
A short piece of informative pop-up text that appears if the mouse-cursor hovers over the control.
The list of 'Things' that the object contains, such as a group of images, a series of lines of text, a number of actions in an actionlist, etc

An array of strings, containing the textual data in controls with more than a single line of data, such as an Edit-Box or a Combo-Box. The array is zero-indexed, ie the lines are numbered [0..numLines-1]

The identifier by which the control is known in the program. The IDE gives it a default name based on the underlying type, for example successive instances of TBitButton would be named Form1.BitBitton1 and Form1.BitButton2; it is up to the application programmer to give them more meaningful names such as ExitButton or OKButton. By default the Name of the control is applied to the Caption for the control, but the text of the Caption may be changed separately.
A window containing context-sensitive menu information that pops up when the right mouse button is clicked on the object.
Determines where the control is located on the parent form or window
Boolean property which, if True, signifies that the contents of the control can be read by the user or the calling routine, but cannot be written or changed.
Allows a small window containing a context-sensitive Help or other description to be displayed when the mouse cursor 'hovers' over the control.
The options available for Style depend upon the sort of Control being considered: for instance the Style may be defined by TFormStyle, TBorderStyle, TButtonStyle etc.
Integer defining where in the sequence of tabs on the Form this control is to lie
Boolean property which if True places this control in the sequence of objects that the user can reach by successively pressing the Tab key

The String of Text that represents the actual data that this control contains. Applies particularly to Text, Memo and StringList types of object. Most of the editing operations (such as Select, Clear, Cut, Copy) are performed in this part of the object, which holds the actual string being edited. If the control contains more than a single line of text, for example TMemo or TComboBox, then the textual elements are arranged as an array of strings (zero-indexed, ie numbered from [0..numLines-1]) in Lines.
If true, the object can be seen on the Form; if False, object is hidden
Logical flag to show whether or not word-wrap is enabled, ie if a word comes close to the end of a line and is going to be too long for the line, it is wrapped down to the next line.

descr.p: Many actions are commonly listed in the 'Events' tab of the Object Inspector. If you select an entry in the list, a ComboBox appears with a DropDown list showing any actions that have aleady been defined, and allowing you to choose one to be associated with this event. Alternatively you can select the ellipsis (three dots ...) and you will be taken to an area of the Source Editor where you can begin typing your own action instructions for the selected event.

While a large number of events is available for any given control, in practice it is only necessary to populate a few of them. For most controls, it is sufficient to provide coding for 'OnClick'; for more complex controls it may be necessary also to provide for 'OnEntry' (when the mouse cursor enters the Control and gives it focus) and 'OnExit' (when the mouse cursor leaves the Control; or you may need to write an event handler for 'OnChange' or 'OnScroll', depending on the nature of the particular control with which you are dealing.

The pop-up menu that appears when you right-click an object in the Form Designer has, as its first item: 'Create default event' and selecting this option will have the same effect as selecting the ellipsis in the Object Inspector for the default event, usually OnClick: you are taken to the Implementation area of the Source Editor where you can type the code for the event handler.

A common strategy in Object-Oriented programming is to provide an ActionList with the facility for entering, removing or editing a number of pre-defined actions from which the most appropriate can be selected to use in any particular instance.

tr.td: Action to be taken if any change is detected (eg mouse move, mouse click, key press, edit text, alter picture, etc)

Action to be taken when the (left) mouse button is clicked. This is usually the main or default action of the control; for example clicking on a button or checkbox initiates the action associated with the checkbox. It may alternatively initate a process of selection, for instance in a TextBox or Memo, or signal the beginning of painting with a Pen or Brush.

A method to emulate in code the effect of clicking on a control. This method is most often found in Button-type controls (TButton, TBitBtn, TSpeedButton etc). A procedure can be written that calls the same code as the OnClick action. This facility can be particularly useful if the activation of one control by clicking causes a cascade of other controls to be activated, and the Click method can be used to initiate the action rather than having the user explicitly click on a lot of controls.
Action to be taken during Drag-Drop manoeuvres, ie when the mouse is used to 'capture' an item or some text etc and move it around the screen to a new location.

Action to be taken when the mouse cursor enters the area occupied by the object, usually transfering focus to that object. This might include changes in the appearance of the object such as highlighting or raising the border.
Action to be taken when the mouse moves out of the area of the object, usually transferring focus out of the object.

Action to be taken for any key-press. Subtly different from OnKeyDown, which simply responds to a key being down, whether or not it was already down when focus was given to this control. OnKeyPress requires that a key becomes pressed while focus is in this control.

Action to be taken if a key is down while focus is in this control. Subtly different from OnKeyPress - for example the key might already have been down when focus entered this control, whereas OnKeyPress requires the key to become pressed while focus is in the control.
Action to be taken if a key is up (ie not pressed) while focus is in this control.
On Mouse Down - Action to be taken if the mouse cursor moves while focus is in this control.
Action to be taken if the mouse button is down while focus is in this control.

Action to be taken if the mouse button is up while the cursor is over this control. Implies that the mouse button was previously down and has been released. The case where the cursor enters the control but the mouse button has not yet been pressed is covered by OnEntry or OnMouseEnter.
Action to be taken when the control is resized. Might include re-alignment of text or selection of a different font size etc.
